alert.note: Alert for Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 8:50PM MDT until August 07 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN TELLER COUNTY... At 850 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved east of the warned area. Doppler radar indicates between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen in the past hour, with flash flooding ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement indicated a rock slide on Highway 24 between Lower Twin Rocks Road and Jade Road. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Divide and Florissant. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
